poem:
Title: Ode to Naked Ambition

In the morning paper,
parchment of fervent squabbles,
echoes of yesterday's scuffles.
'Neath the Tory donor's fables,
germinate contentious gambles.

Laboured leadership, whip withheld,
with Abbott's cry, fires stoked, silence quelled.
Racism, misogyny, Hester's cruel kiss,
Politicking in a world askew, truth - a bygone bliss.

How strange the machinations of power,
Unfold in the fading afternoon hour.
